ygData.subject: Re: Enchanters
ygData.msgSnippet: What kind of sorry ass group were you in? I dont know about your server but on veeshan if a party gets a exec axe and there is only one person that NEEDS it in
ygData.messageBody:
What kind of sorry ass group were you in? I dont know about your server but
on veeshan if a party gets a exec axe and there is only one person that
NEEDS it in the party that person will get it... That is very gay how you
have to roll on a damn axe.
-----Original Message-----
From: Monica Bradlee <mbradlee@...>
To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, December 02, 1999 1:05 AM
Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Enchanters


>From: Monica Bradlee <mbradlee@...>
>
>Mersinaz had an animation then charmed the Undead Froglok Executioner
because it
>had an axe and we used it to kill the cavalier, sadly I won neither random
and
>misssed out on the axe and the apolets, of course I was the only warrior
and the
>only on able to use the axe
>
>Efrieum
>
>Tekdruid wrote:
>
>> From: Tekdruid <Tekdruid@...>
>>
>> On Thursday, December 02, 1999 12:00 AM, Monica Bradlee
>> [SMTP:mbradlee@...] wrote:
>> > From: Monica Bradlee <mbradlee@...>
>> >
>> >
>> > On what someone else said about enchanters, Animations don't count as
pets so
>> > the creature dubbed "evil eye pet" is actually an animation not a pet,
they
>> > just screwed up when the text wrote it
>> >
>> > Efrieum
>> > Level 35 warrior
>> > gonna have a pet and gonna name it Binky
>> >
>>
>> Actually, for players, animations do count as pets. I have tried many
times
>> (usually accidentally) to charm a creature while I had my animation, and
I got
>> that old familiar message.
>>
>> Tinik
>> Enchanter, Veeshan
>>
>>
>
>>
